I'll add a rating in my opinion. 7/10.
5/10 in your preferable {NONPRIME} servers.
8/10 in your preferable {PRIME} servers.
10/10 in any LAN Esport League match.
The better you get at the game, or even if you're terrible, there are aspects like, fun games (hns, zombie, TTT), training (aimbotz), deathmatch, FFA, or casual/comp/scrimmage. These make what CSGO is. CS:GO gives a lot of content to play and mess around with, allowing you to even create your own maps.
What's not allowed is cheating (wall hacking, aim botting, spin botting, macro using, etc.)
Cheating is looked down upon in this game, yet so many people do it.
There is also a small bit of latency still present inside of the game, for everyone, and not just the people with bad internet. Even the people with 10 ping will experience difficulty with shooting players with higher ping, and most of the times get the disadvantage.
So my final rating is 7/10.

Counter Strike: Global Cheating Offensive XD

I started playing CS at v1.6 nearly 20 years ago. In other words, I liked it before it was cool. This iteration maintains what was good about CS then with more improvements than I have room in this textbox to relate.

Edit 2020-07-11: I've got over 1000 hours in-game now, and although there seem to be more cheaters every day I hold out hope that Valve will manage to put some kind of dent in it. I'm playing the Danger Zone mode pretty much exclusively these days as it removes a number of the advantages cheaters and AWPers have in the more closed-in classic maps.
